trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>DateTime</parameterReference> property values must be represented as combined Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) values.
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>DateTime</parameterReference> property values must be represented as combined Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) values.

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Timestamp</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property, which is an opaque property maintained by the Table service, is also represented in this format.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Timestamp</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property, which is an opaque property maintained by the Table service, is also represented in this format.

trans-unit.source: An example of the combined UTC format is as follows.
trans-unit.target: An example of the combined UTC format is as follows.

trans-unit.source: The date is specified first, followed by the literal string "T", which designates the beginning of the time element.
trans-unit.target: The date is specified first, followed by the literal string "T", which designates the beginning of the time element.

trans-unit.source: The literal string "Z" at the end of the string designates that the time is expressed in UTC:
trans-unit.target: The literal string "Z" at the end of the string designates that the time is expressed in UTC:

trans-unit.source: The following code example shows one way to construct the combined UTC format from the current UTC date:
